answerText: The Pretentious Young Ladies [or The Affected Young Ladies, or Les Précieuses ridicules][10] This playwright of The Pretentious Young Ladies would have played Mascarille in the first few productions. He also wrote Tartuffe and The Misanthrope.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 4 | 19 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, Mascarille keeps reciting a "funny poem" he wrote with the punchline, "Stop thief! Stop thief!" For ten points each: [10] Name this satire in which Cathos and Magdelon put on airs of sophistication for their debut in Paris.
